intro: Evolvulus serpylloides, commonly known as the blue morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a herbaceous annual with prostrate or trailing growth habit, often forming dense mats. The plant features heart-shaped, hairy leaves and produces small, trumpet-shaped blue or violet flowers. It thrives in warm, sunny conditions and is often found in disturbed soils. Its rapid growth and ornamental value make it a popular choice for gardeners, though it can become invasive in certain environments.
